meanings.definition: Comparative form of hug, meaning more inclined to give hugs.
meanings.sent1: She is the huggier of the two sisters, always ready for a hug.
meanings.sent2: The teddy bear looked huggier with its outstretched arms.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed even huggier after rolling around in the soft blanket.
meanings.sent4: The cozy sweater felt huggier than a warm embrace on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The oversized pillow was so huggier that it felt like a cloud of comfort.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of hug, meaning having a greater capacity for hugging.
meanings.sent1: The bigger bear was huggier and could hold more tightly.
meanings.sent2: The new couch was huggier, allowing the whole family to snuggle together.
meanings.sent3: The tree with the most branches looked huggier than the others in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The giant stuffed elephant was huggier than any toy she had ever seen.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy blanket was so huggier that it felt like a warm cloud wrapping around you.
